multiplechoice.text: How many billion tonnes of greenhouse gases does the world emit each year?
What proportion of ghg emissions does the energy sector account for?

cards.term: What contribution does food make to greenhouse gas emissions?
cards.definition: Agriculture contributes 18.4%, but the food system as a whole â€“ including processing, packaging, transport and retail - accounts for nearly one quarter of emissions.

cards.term: Road transport accounts for 11.9% of greenhouse gas emissions. Break this figure down, and explain how it could be mitigated.
cards.definition: 60% of road transport emissions come from passenger travel, 40% from road freight (lorries and trucks). If the whole road transport sector could be fully decarbonised electricity mix, we could reduce global emissions by 11.9%.

ranked.text: Rank the top 3 energy sectors by ghg emissions, highest to lowest (one word for each).
Rank shipping, pipeline, road, rail, and aviation transport emissions in ascending order.
